main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a bright light in the night sky over Chicago, Illinois on October 30, 1966.
interesting points: The observer described the light as whiter than the stars and larger than a star.,The light briefly split into two parts and turned bright red before disappearing.,The object left a vapor trail and was estimated to be hovering at about 5 miles high.,The observer noted that the speed of the object was approximately 180 mph.,The observer compared the light to aircraft lights but concluded it was not an aircraft due to its altitude and speed.
sighted object: a bright white light that split into two parts
